Token.Abstract: An RKObjectMapping object describes a transformation between object represenations using key-value coding and run-time type introspection. The mapping is defined in terms of a source object class and a collection of RKPropertyMapping objects describing how key paths in the source representation should be transformed into attributes and relationships on the target object. Object mappings are provided to instances of RKMapperOperation and RKMappingOperation to perform the transformations they describe.
Returns an object mapping for the specified class that is ready for configuration

Parameter.Name: objectClass
Parameter.Abstract: The class that the mapping targets.

Token.Abstract: Initializes the receiver with a given object class. This is the designated initializer.

Parameter.Name: objectClass
Parameter.Abstract: The class that the mapping targets. Cannot be nil.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The receiver, initialized with the given class.

Token.Abstract: Returns an object mapping with an objectClass of NSMutableDictionary.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An object mapping with an object class of NSMutableDictionary.

Token.Abstract: The aggregate collection of attribute and relationship mappings within this object mapping.
The aggregate collection of attribute and relationship mappings within this object mapping.
Returns the property mappings of the receiver in a dictionary, where the keys are the source key paths and the values are instances of RKAttributeMapping or RKRelationshipMapping.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The property mappings of the receiver in a dictionary, where the keys are the source key paths and the values are instances of RKAttributeMapping or RKRelationshipMapping.

Token.Abstract: Returns the property mappings of the receiver in a dictionary, where the keys are the source key paths and the values are instances of RKAttributeMapping or RKRelationshipMapping.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The property mappings of the receiver in a dictionary, where the keys are the source key paths and the values are instances of RKAttributeMapping or RKRelationshipMapping.

Token.Abstract: Returns the property mappings of the receiver in a dictionary, where the keys are the destination key paths and the values are instances of RKAttributeMapping or RKRelationshipMapping.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The property mappings of the receiver in a dictionary, where the keys are the destination key paths and the values are instances of RKAttributeMapping or RKRelationshipMapping.

Token.Abstract: Returns the property mappings of the receiver in a dictionary, where the keys are the destination key paths and the values are instances of RKAttributeMapping or RKRelationshipMapping.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The property mappings of the receiver in a dictionary, where the keys are the destination key paths and the values are instances of RKAttributeMapping or RKRelationshipMapping.

Token.Abstract: The collection of attribute mappings within this object mapping.
The collection of attribute mappings within this object mapping.
The collection of relationship mappings within this object mapping.
The collection of relationship mappings within this object mapping.
Returns the property mapping registered with the receiver with the given source key path.

Parameter.Name: sourceKeyPath
Parameter.Abstract: The key path to retrieve.

Token.Abstract: Returns the property mapping registered with the receiver with the given destinationKeyPath key path.

Parameter.Name: destinationKeyPath
Parameter.Abstract: The key path to retrieve.

Token.Abstract: Adds a property mapping to the receiver.

Parameter.Name: propertyMapping
Parameter.Abstract: The property mapping to be added to the object mapping.

Token.Abstract: Adds an array of RKAttributeMapping or RKRelationshipMapping objects to the receiver.

Parameter.Name: propertyMappings
Parameter.Abstract: The array of property mappings to be added to the object mapping.

Token.Abstract: Removes an RKAttributeMapping or RKRelationshipMapping from the receiver.

Parameter.Name: propertyMapping
Parameter.Abstract: The attribute or relationship mapping to remove.

Token.Abstract: Adds attribute mappings from a given dictionary wherein the keys represent the source key path and the values represent the names of the target attributes on the destination object.

Parameter.Name: keyPathToAttributeNames
Parameter.Abstract: A dictionary keyed by source key to destination attribute name.

Token.Abstract: Adds attribute mappings to the receiver from a given array.

Parameter.Name: An
Parameter.Abstract: array of RKAttributeMapping or NSString values to be added to the receiver's set of attribute mappings,

Token.Abstract: Adds a relationship mapping to the receiver with the given source key path and mapping.

Parameter.Name: sourceKeyPath
Parameter.Abstract: The source key path at which to read the nested representation of the related objects.

Parameter.Name: mapping
Parameter.Abstract: The object mapping with which to process the related object representation.

Token.Abstract: Sets an application-wide default transformation block to be used when attribute or relationship mappings are added to an object mapping by source key path.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: The block to be set as the default source to destination key transformer for all object mappings in the application.

Token.Abstract: Sets a block to executed to transform a source key into a destination key.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: The block to execute when the receiver needs to transform a source key into a destination key. The block has a string return value specifying the destination key and accepts a single string argument: the source key that is to be transformed.

Token.Abstract: Adds an attribute mapping from a dynamic nesting key value to an attribute. The mapped attribute name can then be referenced within other attribute mappings to access the nested content.
Adds an attribute mapping to a dynamic nesting key from an attribute. The mapped attribute name can then be referenced wthin other attribute mappings to map content under the nesting key path.
The target class that the receiver describes a mapping for.
The target class that the receiver describes a mapping for.
When YES, any attributes that have mappings defined but are not present within the source object will be set to nil, clearing any existing value.
When YES, any attributes that have mappings defined but are not present within the source object will be set to nil, clearing any existing value.
When YES, any relationships that have mappings defined but are not present within the source object will be set to nil, clearing any existing value.
When YES, any relationships that have mappings defined but are not present within the source object will be set to nil, clearing any existing value.
When YES, key-value validation will be invoked at object mapping time.
When YES, key-value validation will be invoked at object mapping time.
Returns the default value to be assigned to the specified attribute when it is missing from a mappable payload.

An array of NSFormatter objects to use when mapping string values into NSDate attributes on the target objectClass. Each date formatter will be invoked with the string value being mapped until one of the date formatters does not return nil.

An array of NSFormatter objects to use when mapping string values into NSDate attributes on the target objectClass. Each date formatter will be invoked with the string value being mapped until one of the date formatters does not return nil.

The NSFormatter object for your application's preferred date and time configuration. This date formatter will be used when generating string representations of NSDate attributes (i.e. during serialization to URL form encoded or JSON format).

The NSFormatter object for your application's preferred date and time configuration. This date formatter will be used when generating string representations of NSDate attributes (i.e. during serialization to URL form encoded or JSON format).
Generates an inverse mapping for the rules specified within this object mapping.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A new mapping that will map the inverse of the receiver.

Token.Abstract: Returns the class of the attribute or relationship property of the target objectClass with the given name.

Parameter.Name: propertyName
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the property we would like to retrieve the type of.

Token.Abstract: Returns the class of the attribute or relationship property of the target objectClass at the given key path.

Parameter.Name: propertyName
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the property we would like to retrieve the type of.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The class of the property at the given key path.

Token.Abstract: Returns the collection of default date formatters that will be used for all object mappings that have not been configured specifically.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An array of NSFormatter objects used when mapping strings into NSDate attributes

Token.Abstract: Sets the collection of default date formatters to the specified array. The array should contain configured instances of NSDateFormatter in the order in which you want them applied during object mapping operations.

Parameter.Name: dateFormatters
Parameter.Abstract: An array of date formatters to replace the existing defaults.

Token.Abstract: Adds a date formatter instance to the default collection

Parameter.Name: dateFormatter
Parameter.Abstract: An NSFormatter object to prepend to the default formatters collection

Token.Abstract: Convenience method for quickly constructing a date formatter and adding it to the collection of default date formatters. The locale is auto-configured to enUSPOSIX.

Parameter.Name: dateFormatString
Parameter.Abstract: The dateFormat string to assign to the newly constructed NSDateFormatter instance

Parameter.Name: nilOrTimeZone
Parameter.Abstract: The NSTimeZone object to configure on the NSDateFormatter instance. Defaults to UTC time.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A new NSDateFormatter will be prepended to the defaultDateFormatters with the specified date format and time zone

Token.Abstract: Returns the preferred date formatter to use when generating NSString representations from NSDate attributes. This type of transformation occurs when RestKit is mapping local objects into JSON or form encoded serializations that do not have a native time construct.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The preferred NSFormatter object to use when serializing dates into strings

Token.Abstract: Sets the preferred date formatter to use when generating NSString representations from NSDate attributes. This type of transformation occurs when RestKit is mapping local objects into JSON or form encoded serializations that do not have a native time construct.

Parameter.Name: dateFormatter
Parameter.Abstract: The NSFormatter object to designate as the new preferred instance
